org.spongepowered.api.text.format

Class TextStyle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.spongepowered.api.text.format.TextStyle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TextElement
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TextStyle.Base

    @CatalogedBy(value=TextStyles.class)
public class TextStyle
extends Object
implements TextElement
    Represents an immutable text style of a Text. It is a utility that is not normally present in Minecraft. It can be either empty, a TextStyle.Base with an additional legacy formatting code or a composite.

    Combined styles can be created using TextStyles.of(TextStyle...) or using one of the and(TextStyle...), andNot(TextStyle...) or negate() method.

    Each individual style within a TextStyle, e.g. bold, italic is not just a boolean, but an Optional&lt;Boolean&gt; since it can be unapplied (or, in Optional terms, "empty"). These styles will hereafter be referred to as properties.
    See the OptBool utility class for working with properties.

    Implementation note: Absent styles should not appear in the final chat component JSON. Properties that are set to true or false should appear, even if they override inherited properties.

    See Also:
    TextStyles

      static class  TextStyle.Base

      • contains

        public boolean contains(TextStyle... styles)
        Returns whether the given TextStyle is contained in this TextStyle.

        For example, a TextStyle with bold: true, italic: true} would return true for contains( TextStyles.BOLD) and contains( TextStyles.ITALIC).

        If the specified TextStyle is a composite of multiple styles it returns true if this style has at least all of the properties set in the specified style.

        Parameters:
        styles - The text styles to check
        Returns:
        true if the given text styles are contained in this text style

      • negate

        public TextStyle negate()
        Negates this TextStyle. This is useful for undoing text styles that are inherited from parent messages.
        Returns:
        The inverse of this text style

      • and

        public TextStyle and(TextStyle... styles)
        Composes this TextStyle with the specified text styles.
        Parameters:
        styles - The text styles to compose this one with
        Returns:
        A new text style composed out of the given text styles

      • andNot

        public TextStyle andNot(TextStyle... styles)
        Composes this TextStyle with the passed in TextStyles, but negates them before composition. This is the same as negating all the passed in TextStyle and then using the and(TextStyle...) method.
        Parameters:
        styles - The text styles to compose this one with
        Returns:
        A new text style composed out of the given text styles
